attributes.action: Let students be released from their final student accommodation tendencies
attributes.additional_details: As I believe it is unfair for students who are stuck in their accommodation or now living at home due to the cornavirus and have to pay rent still for their student tendencies, that money could be used to help their families or keep themselves a float during these times .. I want students to be released from their tendencies as we no longer go to uni due to the cornavirus.
attributes.background: I want parliament to make an official statement saying student accommodations should allowed their students to be released from their final student year tendencies (April to August) due to cornavirus and not that university is off

rejection.details:
Suspending payments or providing refunds for tuition fees and rent are a matter for individual universities and landlords, and not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want the Government to refund university rent and tuition fees due to coronavirus, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302855

If you want the Government to encourage lenders, landlords and utilities to freeze payments during lockdown, you may wish to sign this petition: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302256

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
